00049 #define BPy_BMLoopUV_Check(v)  (Py_TYPE(v) == &BPy_BMLoopUV_Type)
00050 
00051 typedef struct BPy_BMLoopUV {
00052     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00053     MLoopUV *data;
00054 } BPy_BMLoopUV;
00055 
00056 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmloopuv_uv_doc,
00057 "Loops UV (as a 2D Vector).\n\n:type: :class:`mathutils.Vector`"
00058 );
00059 static PyObject *bpy_bmloopuv_uv_get(BPy_BMLoopUV *self, void *UNUSED(closure))
00060 {
00061     return Vector_CreatePyObject(self->data->uv, 2, Py_WRAP, NULL);
00062 }
00063 
00064 static int bpy_bmloopuv_uv_set(BPy_BMLoopUV *self, PyObject *value, void *UNUSED(closure))
00065 {
00066     float tvec[2];
00067     if (mathutils_array_parse(tvec, 2, 2, value, "BMLoopUV.uv") != -1) {
00068         copy_v2_v2(self->data->uv, tvec);
00069         return 0;
00070     }
00071     else {
00072         return -1;
00073     }
00074 }

00076 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmloopuv_flag__pin_uv_doc,
00077 "UV pin state.\n\n:type: boolean"

00080 "UV select state.\n\n:type: boolean"

00082 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmloopuv_flag__select_edge_doc,

00087 static PyObject *bpy_bmloopuv_flag_get(BPy_BMLoopUV *self, void *flag_p)
00088 {
00089     const int flag = GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(flag_p);
00090     return PyBool_FromLong(self->data->flag & flag);
00091 }
00092 
00093 static int bpy_bmloopuv_flag_set(BPy_BMLoopUV *self, PyObject *value, void *flag_p)
00094 {
00095     const int flag = GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(flag_p);
00096 
00097     switch (PyLong_AsLong(value)) {
00098         case TRUE:
00099             self->data->flag |= flag;
00100             return 0;
00101         case FALSE:
00102             self->data->flag &= ~flag;
00103             return 0;
00104         default:
00105             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00106                             "expected a boolean type 0/1");
00107             return -1;
00108     }
00109 }
00110 
00111 static PyGetSetDef bpy_bmloopuv_getseters[] = {
00112     /* attributes match rna_def_mloopuv  */
00113     {(char *)"uv",          (getter)bpy_bmloopuv_uv_get,   (setter)bpy_bmloopuv_uv_set,   (char *)bpy_bmloopuv_uv_doc, NULL},
00114     {(char *)"pin_uv",      (getter)bpy_bmloopuv_flag_get, (setter)bpy_bmloopuv_flag_set, (char *)bpy_bmloopuv_flag__pin_uv_doc, (void *)MLOOPUV_PINNED},
00115     {(char *)"select",      (getter)bpy_bmloopuv_flag_get, (setter)bpy_bmloopuv_flag_set, (char *)bpy_bmloopuv_flag__select_doc, (void *)MLOOPUV_VERTSEL},
00116     {(char *)"select_edge", (getter)bpy_bmloopuv_flag_get, (setter)bpy_bmloopuv_flag_set, (char *)bpy_bmloopuv_flag__select_edge_doc, (void *)MLOOPUV_EDGESEL},
00117 
00118     {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} /* Sentinel */
00119 };

00138 int BPy_BMLoopUV_AssignPyObject(struct MLoopUV *mloopuv, PyObject *value)
00139 {
00140     if (UNLIKELY(!BPy_BMLoopUV_Check(value))) {
00141         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError, "expected BMLoopUV, not a %.200s", Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
00142         return -1;
00143     }
00144     else {
00145         *((MLoopUV *)mloopuv) = *(((BPy_BMLoopUV *)value)->data);
00146         return 0;
00147     }
00148 }

00150 PyObject *BPy_BMLoopUV_CreatePyObject(struct MLoopUV *mloopuv)
00151 {
00152     BPy_BMLoopUV *self = PyObject_New(BPy_BMLoopUV, &BPy_BMLoopUV_Type);
00153     self->data = mloopuv;
00154     return (PyObject *)self;
00155 }

00159 /* Mesh Loop Color
00160  * *************** */
00161 
00162 /* This simply provices a color wrapper for
00163  * color which uses mathutils callbacks for mathutils.Color
00164  */
00165 
00166 #define MLOOPCOL_FROM_CAPSULE(color_capsule)  \
00167     ((MLoopCol *)PyCapsule_GetPointer(color_capsule, NULL))
00168 
00169 static void mloopcol_to_float(const MLoopCol *mloopcol, float col_r[3])
00170 {
00171     rgb_uchar_to_float(col_r, (unsigned char *)&mloopcol->r);
00172 }
00173 
00174 static void mloopcol_from_float(MLoopCol *mloopcol, const float col[3])
00175 {
00176     rgb_float_to_uchar((unsigned char *)&mloopcol->r, col);
00177 }
00178 
00179 static unsigned char mathutils_bmloopcol_cb_index = -1;
00180 
00181 static int mathutils_bmloopcol_check(BaseMathObject *UNUSED(bmo))
00182 {
00183     /* always ok */
00184     return 0;
00185 }
00186 
00187 static int mathutils_bmloopcol_get(BaseMathObject *bmo, int UNUSED(subtype))
00188 {
00189     MLoopCol *mloopcol = MLOOPCOL_FROM_CAPSULE(bmo->cb_user);
00190     mloopcol_to_float(mloopcol, bmo->data);
00191     return 0;
00192 }
00193 
00194 static int mathutils_bmloopcol_set(BaseMathObject *bmo, int UNUSED(subtype))
00195 {
00196     MLoopCol *mloopcol = MLOOPCOL_FROM_CAPSULE(bmo->cb_user);
00197     mloopcol_from_float(mloopcol, bmo->data);
00198     return 0;
00199 }
00200 
00201 static int mathutils_bmloopcol_get_index(BaseMathObject *bmo, int subtype, int UNUSED(index))
00202 {
00203     /* lazy, avoid repeteing the case statement */
00204     if (mathutils_bmloopcol_get(bmo, subtype) == -1)
00205         return -1;
00206     return 0;
00207 }
00208 
00209 static int mathutils_bmloopcol_set_index(BaseMathObject *bmo, int subtype, int index)
00210 {
00211     const float f = bmo->data[index];
00212 
00213     /* lazy, avoid repeteing the case statement */
00214     if (mathutils_bmloopcol_get(bmo, subtype) == -1)
00215         return -1;
00216 
00217     bmo->data[index] = f;
00218     return mathutils_bmloopcol_set(bmo, subtype);
00219 }
00220 
00221 Mathutils_Callback mathutils_bmloopcol_cb = {
00222     mathutils_bmloopcol_check,
00223     mathutils_bmloopcol_get,
00224     mathutils_bmloopcol_set,
00225     mathutils_bmloopcol_get_index,
00226     mathutils_bmloopcol_set_index
00227 };
00228 
00229 static void bm_init_types_bmloopcol(void)
00230 {
00231     /* pass */
00232     mathutils_bmloopcol_cb_index = Mathutils_RegisterCallback(&mathutils_bmloopcol_cb);
00233 }
00234 
00235 int BPy_BMLoopColor_AssignPyObject(struct MLoopCol *mloopcol, PyObject *value)
00236 {
00237     float tvec[3];
00238     if (mathutils_array_parse(tvec, 3, 3, value, "BMLoopCol") != -1) {
00239         mloopcol_from_float(mloopcol, tvec);
00240         return 0;
00241     }
00242     else {
00243         return -1;
00244     }
00245 }
00246 
00247 PyObject *BPy_BMLoopColor_CreatePyObject(struct MLoopCol *data)
00248 {
00249     PyObject *color_capsule;
00250     color_capsule = PyCapsule_New(data, NULL, NULL);
00251     return Color_CreatePyObject_cb(color_capsule, mathutils_bmloopcol_cb_index, 0);
00252 }

00284 #define BPy_BMDeformVert_Check(v)  (Py_TYPE(v) == &BPy_BMDeformVert_Type)
00285 
00286 typedef struct BPy_BMDeformVert {
00287     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00288     MDeformVert *data;
00289 } BPy_BMDeformVert;
00290 
00291 
00292 /* Mapping Protocols
00293  * ================= */
00294 
00295 static int bpy_bmdeformvert_len(BPy_BMDeformVert *self)
00296 {
00297     return self->data->totweight;
00298 }
00299 
00300 static PyObject *bpy_bmdeformvert_subscript(BPy_BMDeformVert *self, PyObject *key)
00301 {
00302     if (PyIndex_Check(key)) {
00303         int i;
00304         i = PyNumber_AsSsize_t(key, PyExc_IndexError);
00305         if (i == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) {
00306             return NULL;
00307         }
00308         else {
00309             MDeformWeight *dw = defvert_find_index(self->data, i);
00310 
00311             if (dw == NULL) {
00312                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_KeyError, "BMDeformVert[key] = x: "
00313                                 "key not found");
00314                 return NULL;
00315             }
00316             else {
00317                 return PyFloat_FromDouble(dw->weight);
00318             }
00319         }
00320     }
00321     else {
00322         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00323                      "BMDeformVert keys must be integers, not %.200s",
00324                      Py_TYPE(key)->tp_name);
00325         return NULL;
00326     }
00327 }
00328 
00329 static int bpy_bmdeformvert_ass_subscript(BPy_BMDeformVert *self, PyObject *key, PyObject *value)
00330 {
00331     if (PyIndex_Check(key)) {
00332         int i;
00333 
00334         i = PyNumber_AsSsize_t(key, PyExc_IndexError);
00335         if (i == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) {
00336             return -1;
00337         }
00338 
00339         if (value) {
00340             /* dvert[group_index] = 0.5 */
00341             if (i < 0) {
00342                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_KeyError, "BMDeformVert[key] = x: "
00343                                 "weight keys can't be negative");
00344                 return -1;
00345             }
00346             else {
00347                 MDeformWeight *dw = defvert_verify_index(self->data, i);
00348                 const float f = PyFloat_AsDouble(value);
00349                 if (f == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) { // parsed key not a number
00350                     PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00351                                     "BMDeformVert[key] = x: "
00352                                     "argument not a number");
00353                     return -1;
00354                 }
00355 
00356                 dw->weight = CLAMPIS(f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00357             }
00358         }
00359         else {
00360             /* del dvert[group_index] */
00361             MDeformWeight *dw = defvert_find_index(self->data, i);
00362 
00363             if (dw == NULL) {
00364                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_KeyError, "del BMDeformVert[key]: "
00365                                 "key not found");
00366             }
00367             defvert_remove_group(self->data, dw);
00368         }
00369 
00370         return 0;
00371 
00372     }
00373     else {
00374         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00375                      "BMDeformVert keys must be integers, not %.200s",
00376                      Py_TYPE(key)->tp_name);
00377         return -1;
00378     }
00379 }
00380 
00381 static int bpy_bmdeformvert_contains(BPy_BMDeformVert *self, PyObject *value)
00382 {
00383     const int key = PyLong_AsSsize_t(value);
00384 
00385     if (key == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) {
00386         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00387                         "BMDeformVert.__contains__: expected an int");
00388         return -1;
00389     }
00390 
00391     return (defvert_find_index(self->data, key) != NULL) ? 1 : 0;
00392 }
00393 
00394 /* only defined for __contains__ */
00395 static PySequenceMethods bpy_bmdeformvert_as_sequence = {
00396     (lenfunc)bpy_bmdeformvert_len,               /* sq_length */
00397     NULL,                                        /* sq_concat */
00398     NULL,                                        /* sq_repeat */
00399 
00400     /* note: if this is set PySequence_Check() returns True,
00401      * but in this case we dont want to be treated as a seq */
00402     NULL,                                        /* sq_item */
00403 
00404     NULL,                                        /* sq_slice */
00405     NULL,                                        /* sq_ass_item */
00406     NULL,                                        /* *was* sq_ass_slice */
00407     (objobjproc)bpy_bmdeformvert_contains,  /* sq_contains */
00408     (binaryfunc) NULL,                           /* sq_inplace_concat */
00409     (ssizeargfunc) NULL,                         /* sq_inplace_repeat */
00410 };
00411 
00412 static PyMappingMethods bpy_bmdeformvert_as_mapping = {
00413     (lenfunc)bpy_bmdeformvert_len,
00414     (binaryfunc)bpy_bmdeformvert_subscript,
00415     (objobjargproc)bpy_bmdeformvert_ass_subscript
00416 };

00418 /* Methods
00419  * ======= */
00420 
00421 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmdeformvert_keys_doc,
00422 ".. method:: keys()\n"
00423 "\n"
00424 "   Return the group indices used by this vertex\n"
00425 "   (matching pythons dict.keys() functionality).\n"
00426 "\n"
00427 "   :return: the deform group this vertex uses\n"
00428 "   :rtype: list of ints\n"
00429 );
00430 static PyObject *bpy_bmdeformvert_keys(BPy_BMDeformVert *self)
00431 {
00432     PyObject *ret;
00433     int i;
00434     MDeformWeight *dw = self->data->dw;
00435 
00436     ret = PyList_New(self->data->totweight);
00437     for (i = 0; i < self->data->totweight; i++, dw++) {
00438         PyList_SET_ITEM(ret, i, PyLong_FromSsize_t(dw->def_nr));
00439     }
00440 
00441     return ret;
00442 }
00443 
00444 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmdeformvert_values_doc,
00445 ".. method:: items()\n"
00446 "\n"
00447 "   Return (group, weight) pairs for this vertex\n"
00448 "   (matching pythons dict.items() functionality).\n"
00449 "\n"
00450 "   :return: (key, value) pairs for each deform weight of this vertex.\n"
00451 "   :rtype: list of tuples\n"
00452 );
00453 static PyObject *bpy_bmdeformvert_values(BPy_BMDeformVert *self)
00454 {
00455     PyObject *ret;
00456     int i;
00457     MDeformWeight *dw = self->data->dw;
00458 
00459     ret = PyList_New(self->data->totweight);
00460     for (i = 0; i < self->data->totweight; i++, dw++) {
00461         PyList_SET_ITEM(ret, i, PyFloat_FromDouble(dw->weight));
00462     }
00463 
00464     return ret;
00465 }
00466 
00467 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmdeformvert_items_doc,
00468 ".. method:: values()\n"
00469 "\n"
00470 "   Return the weights of the deform vertex\n"
00471 "   (matching pythons dict.values() functionality).\n"
00472 "\n"
00473 "   :return: The weights that influence this vertex\n"
00474 "   :rtype: list of floats\n"
00475 );
00476 static PyObject *bpy_bmdeformvert_items(BPy_BMDeformVert *self)
00477 {
00478     PyObject *ret;
00479     PyObject *item;
00480     int i;
00481     MDeformWeight *dw = self->data->dw;
00482 
00483     ret = PyList_New(self->data->totweight);
00484     for (i = 0; i < self->data->totweight; i++, dw++) {
00485         item = PyTuple_New(2);
00486 
00487         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(item, 0, PyLong_FromSsize_t(dw->def_nr));
00488         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(item, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(dw->weight));
00489 
00490         PyList_SET_ITEM(ret, i, item);
00491     }
00492 
00493     return ret;
00494 }
00495 
00496 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmdeformvert_get_doc,
00497 ".. method:: get(key, default=None)\n"
00498 "\n"
00499 "   Returns the deform weight matching the key or default\n"
00500 "   when not found (matches pythons dictionary function of the same name).\n"
00501 "\n"
00502 "   :arg key: The key associated with deform weight.\n"
00503 "   :type key: int\n"
00504 "   :arg default: Optional argument for the value to return if\n"
00505 "      *key* is not found.\n"
00506 "   :type default: Undefined\n"
00507 );
00508 static PyObject *bpy_bmdeformvert_get(BPy_BMDeformVert *self, PyObject *args)
00509 {
00510     int key;
00511     PyObject *def = Py_None;
00512 
00513     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "i|O:get", &key, &def)) {
00514         return NULL;
00515     }
00516     else {
00517         MDeformWeight *dw = defvert_find_index(self->data, key);
00518 
00519         if (dw) {
00520             return PyFloat_FromDouble(dw->weight);
00521         }
00522         else {
00523             return Py_INCREF(def), def;
00524         }
00525     }
00526 }
00527 
00528 
00529 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmdeformvert_clear_doc,
00530 ".. method:: clear()\n"
00531 "\n"
00532 "   Clears all weights.\n"
00533 );
00534 static PyObject *bpy_bmdeformvert_clear(BPy_BMDeformVert *self)
00535 {
00536     defvert_clear(self->data);
00537 
00538     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00539 }

00571 int BPy_BMDeformVert_AssignPyObject(struct MDeformVert *dvert, PyObject *value)
00572 {
00573     if (UNLIKELY(!BPy_BMDeformVert_Check(value))) {
00574         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError, "expected BMDeformVert, not a %.200s", Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
00575         return -1;
00576     }
00577     else {
00578         MDeformVert *dvert_src = ((BPy_BMDeformVert *)value)->data;
00579         if (LIKELY(dvert != dvert_src)) {
00580             defvert_copy(dvert, dvert_src);
00581         }
00582         return 0;
00583     }
00584 }
00585 
00586 PyObject *BPy_BMDeformVert_CreatePyObject(struct MDeformVert *dvert)
00587 {
00588     BPy_BMDeformVert *self = PyObject_New(BPy_BMDeformVert, &BPy_BMDeformVert_Type);
00589     self->data = dvert;
00590     return (PyObject *)self;
00591 }
